newsitem.title: GREECE: DRACHMA UP VS ECU, SHORT-RUN DEPOS FIRM, BONDS IDLE.
newsitem.headline: DRACHMA UP VS ECU, SHORT-RUN DEPOS FIRM, BONDS IDLE.

text.p: The drachma was gaining ground against the ecu in late quiet dealings, trading around 310.58/63, bonds were unmoved and a spike in the overnight rate pulled short-term depos up on tighter liquidity, traders said.

"The drachma has strengthened considerably against the ecu helped by the weaker mark crosses," said a forex dealer at a foreign bank. "Ecu/drachma opened around 311 but has eased around 310.58/63 in late dealings, close to its intraday low of 310.60."
Short-term depos and forex forwards were trading higher on tighter overnight liquidity conditions in late quiet trade.
"Tighter liquidity conditions have driven the overnight rate higher and pulled other shorts up in the process," a dealer at a foreign bank said. "My feeling is depos and forwards are heading lower."
Bond prices were unmoved with most investors on the sidelines affected by last week's sell off that left some of them bruised, dealers said.
"Investors are cautious following last week's turbulence and bond prices are on a holding pattern," said a bond trader at a foreign bank.
The mark was quoted at 159.37/47 from Monday's 159.575 fix, the dollar at 275.31/41 drachmas from 274.530 and the ecu at 310.60/70 from 310.810 drachmas.
The National Bank of Greece , the domestic money market's biggest player, quoted the following late rates:
